thread.title: Antonio Conte warns his Chelsea side against complacency as he reminds table-toppers of his previous slip-ups
thread.title_full: Antonio Conte warns his Chelsea side against complacency as he reminds table-toppers of his previous slip-ups

author: John Cross
title: Antonio Conte warns his Chelsea side against complacency as he reminds table-toppers of his previous slip-ups
text:
Share this video Watch Next 
“Above all in this league, because I think in this league easy games don’t exist. And you can see in the previous games, Swansea beat Liverpool and Watford beat Arsenal. A lot of examples. For this reason I think that we must pay great attention to prepare every game with great attention. 
“I think every manager has their own experience. I think about this situation, I have great experience. Not only as a manager but above all as a player. The Blues effectively ended Arsenal's title challenge this weekend (Photo: Clive Rose) 
“Because when you play and captain for years for Juventus you have a lot of these situations. I won five titles as a footballer but a lot of times I arrived in second place. And I think when you arrive in second place it’s not good. The people only remember who win. 
“I remember the second place more. I bring a lot of examples from the national team. I lost a lot of finals, of the [1994] World Cup and Euro 2000. You must know my hunger in every game. The will to fight, the will to win. I know my career I was lucky to win a lot, but also I lost a lot.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
